title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {scrappy: A Simple Web Scraper},   author = {Roberto Villegas-Diaz},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.2, https://villegar.github.io/scrappy/, https://scrappy.robertovillegas-diaz.com/},   url = {https://github.com/villegar/scrappy/}, }

title: A Simple Web Scraper
text: goal scrappy provide simple functions scrape data different websites academic purposes.

title: A Simple Web Scraper
text: can install released version scrappy CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: A Simple Web Scraper
text: NOTE: run following examples computer, need download install Mozilla Firefox (https://www.mozilla.org/en-GB/firefox/new/). Alternatively, can replace value browser call RSelenium::rsDriver.

title: A Simple Web Scraper
text: Network Environment Weather Applications Cornell University. Website: http://newa.cornell.edu Partial output previous example:
code: # Create RSelenium session rD <- RSelenium::rsDriver(browser = "firefox", port = 4549L, verbose = FALSE)  # Call scrappy out <- scrappy::newa_nrcc(   client = rD$client,   year = 2020,   month = 12, # December   station = "gbe", # Geneva (Bejo) station   save_file = FALSE ) # Don't save output to a CSV file # Stop server rD$server$stop()

title: A Simple Web Scraper
text: Extract reviews Sefton Park Liverpool (20 recent): Output removing original authors’ names URL profiles:
code: # Create RSelenium session rD <- RSelenium::rsDriver(browser = "firefox", port = 4549L, verbose = FALSE)  # Call scrappy out <- scrappy::google_maps(   client = rD$client,   name = "Sefton Park",   max_reviews = 20 ) # Stop server rD$server$stop()

title: A Simple Web Scraper
code: # Create RSelenium session rD <- RSelenium::rsDriver(browser = "firefox", port = 4549L, verbose = FALSE)  # Retrieve GP practices near L69 3GL # (Waterhouse building, University of Liverpool) out <- scrappy::find_a_gp(rD$client, postcode = "L69 3GL")  # Stop server rD$server$stop()

what: (Assisted) request of EDINA's Digimap data from the Ordnance Survey — digimap_os
title: (Assisted) request of EDINA's Digimap data from the Ordnance Survey — digimap_os
text: Digimap’s Ordnance Survey collection provides full range topographic Ordnance Survey data UK. Note function helps request data, request processed, manually download data (email instructions provided Digimap).

title: (Assisted) request of EDINA's Digimap data from the Ordnance Survey — digimap_os
code: digimap_os(   client,   area_name = NULL,   dataset = NULL,   format = NULL,   version = NULL,   org = Sys.getenv("ORG"),   sleep = 1 )

title: (Assisted) request of EDINA's Digimap data from the Ordnance Survey — digimap_os
text: https://digimap.edina.ac.uk/os

title: (Assisted) request of EDINA's Digimap data from the Ordnance Survey — digimap_os
text: client RSelenium client. area_name String UK national grid name (e.g., 'SD', 'SD20'). See ordnancesurvey.co.uk/documents/resources/guide--nationalgrid.pdf. dataset String name data set download (e.g., 'NTM' National Tree Map 'Terrain-5 DTM' OS Terrain 5 Digital Terrain Model). See https://digimap.edina.ac.uk/help/-maps--data/os_products/. format String data format (e.g., 'SHAPE'). See https://digimap.edina.ac.uk/help/-maps--data/os_products/. version String version data set (e.g., 'July 2023'). See https://digimap.edina.ac.uk/help/-maps--data/os_products/. org String organisation name (login purposes, can done manually). Done per session. sleep Integer number seconds use pause actions web page.

title: (Assisted) request of EDINA's Digimap data from the Ordnance Survey — digimap_os
text: Logic value status data request.

what:
Convert duration to date-time
Convert a string with a duration (e.g. 'an hour ago') to a date-time string,
based on a reference time — duration2datetime

Convert duration to date-time
Convert a string with a duration (e.g. 'an hour ago') to a date-time string,
based on a reference time — duration2datetime
text: str String duration (see examples) ref_time Reference time (default: Sys.time(), current time) output_format String format output (default: "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S %Z")

title:
Convert duration to date-time
Convert a string with a duration (e.g. 'an hour ago') to a date-time string,
based on a reference time — duration2datetime
text: Date-time object based input string, str, reference time ref_time.

title:
Convert duration to date-time
Convert a string with a duration (e.g. 'an hour ago') to a date-time string,
based on a reference time — duration2datetime
code: duration2datetime("a minute ago") #> [1] "2023-12-18 15:27:21 UTC" duration2datetime("an hour ago") #> [1] "2023-12-18 14:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("a day ago") #> [1] "2023-12-17 15:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("a week ago") #> [1] "2023-12-11 15:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("a month ago") #> [1] "2023-11-18 04:58:21 UTC" duration2datetime("a year ago") #> [1] "2022-12-18 09:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("2 minutes ago") #> [1] "2023-12-18 15:26:21 UTC" duration2datetime("2 hours ago") #> [1] "2023-12-18 13:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("2 days ago") #> [1] "2023-12-16 15:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("2 weeks ago") #> [1] "2023-12-04 15:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("2 months ago") #> [1] "2023-10-18 18:28:21 UTC" duration2datetime("2 years ago") #> [1] "2021-12-18 03:28:21 UTC"

title: Scrape Google Maps' reviews — google_maps
text: Scrape Google Maps' reviews

title: Scrape Google Maps' reviews — google_maps
code: google_maps(   client,   name,   place_id = NULL,   base = "https://www.google.com/maps/search/?api=1&query=",   sleep = 1,   max_reviews = 100,   result_id = 1,   with_text = FALSE )

title: Scrape Google Maps' reviews — google_maps
text: client RSelenium client. name String name target place. place_id String unique ID target place, useful one place name. base String base URL Google Maps website. sleep Integer number seconds use pause actions web page. max_reviews Integer maximum number reviews scrape. number existing reviews define actual number reviews returned. result_id Integer result position use, relevant multiple matches given name found. with_text Boolean value indicate max_reviews account reviews comment.

title: Scrape Google Maps' reviews — google_maps
text: Tibble reviews extracted Google Maps.

title: Scrape Google Maps' reviews — google_maps
code: if (FALSE) { # Create RSelenium session rD <- RSelenium::rsDriver(browser = "firefox", port = 4544L, verbose = FALSE) # Retrieve reviews for Sefton Park in Liverpool sefton_park_reviews_tb <-   scrappy::google_maps(     client = rD$client,     name = "Sefton Park",     place_id = "ChIJrTCHJVkge0gRm1LWF0fSPgw",     max_reviews = 20   )  sefton_park_reviews_tb_with_text <-   scrappy::google_maps(     client = rD$client,     name = "Sefton Park",     place_id = "ChIJrTCHJVkge0gRm1LWF0fSPgw",     max_reviews = 20,     with_text = TRUE   ) # Stop server rD$server$stop() }

what: NEWA v3 Weather Stations dataset — newa3_stations
title: NEWA v3 Weather Stations dataset — newa3_stations
text: dataset containing information 801 weather stations Network Environment Weather Applications (NEWA) version 3 Cornell University.

title: NEWA v3 Weather Stations dataset — newa3_stations
NEWA v3 Weather Stations dataset — newa3_stations
text: data frame 801 rows 10 variables: name Station's name. state State station located. code Station's code. affiliation Entity entity affiliated. affiliation_url Entity's URL. latitude Station's latitude. longitude Station's longitude. elevation Station's elevation. start_year Start year (data available). is_icao Boolean flag indicate station part International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) (e.g airport).

title: NEWA v3 Weather Stations dataset — newa3_stations
text: https://newa.cornell.edu

title: NEWA v3 Weather Stations dataset — newa3_stations
text: Network Environment Weather Applications support@newa.zendesk.com

what: Retrieve data from NEWA at Cornell University — newa_nrcc
title: Retrieve data from NEWA at Cornell University — newa_nrcc
text: Retrieve Weather data Network Environment Weather Applications (NEWA) Cornell University.

title: Retrieve data from NEWA at Cornell University — newa_nrcc
code: newa_nrcc(   client,   year,   month,   station,   base = "http://newa.nrcc.cornell.edu/newaLister",   interval = "hly",   sleep = 6,   table_id = "#dtable",   path = getwd(),   save_file = TRUE )

title: Retrieve data from NEWA at Cornell University — newa_nrcc
text: client RSelenium client. year Numeric value year. month Numeric value month. station String station abbreviation. Check http://newa.cornell.edu/index.php?page=station-pages list. base Base URL (default: http://newa.nrcc.cornell.edu/newaLister). interval String data interval (default: hly, hourly). sleep Numeric value number seconds wait page load results (default: 6 seconds). table_id String unique HTML ID assigned table containing data (default: #dtable) path String path location CSV files stored (default: getwd()). save_file Boolean flag indicate whether output stored CSV file.

title: Retrieve data from NEWA at Cornell University — newa_nrcc
text: Tibble data retrieved server.

title: Retrieve data from NEWA at Cornell University — newa_nrcc
code: if (FALSE) { # Create RSelenium session rD <- RSelenium::rsDriver(browser = "firefox", port = 4544L, verbose = FALSE) # Retrieve data for the Geneva (Bejo) station on 2020/12 scrappy::newa_nrcc(rD$client, 2020, 12, "gbe") # Stop server rD$server$stop() }

title: Retrieve data from NEWA v3.0 at Cornell University — newa_nrcc3
text: year Numeric value start year. month Numeric value start month. day Numeric value start day. hour Numeric value start hour. station String station abbreviation. Check scrappy::newa3_stations list stations abbreviations. base Base URL (default: https://hrly.nrcc.cornell.edu/stnHrly).

title: Retrieve data from NEWA v3.0 at Cornell University — newa_nrcc3

text: Scroll reviews container load reviews

title: Scroll reviews — scroll_reviews
text: client RSelenium client. using String "css" "xpath". value String css tag xpath. scroll_px Integer number pixels scroll. sleep Integer number seconds use pause actions web page.

title: Sort reviews — sort_reviews
text: Sort reviews

title: Sort reviews — sort_reviews
code: sort_reviews(   client,   using = "xpath",   value_sort_btn = "//button[@data-value='Sort']",   value_sort_options = "//div[@role='menuitemradio']",   sleep = 1,   sort_index = 2 )

title: Sort reviews — sort_reviews
text: client RSelenium client. using String "css" "xpath". value_sort_btn String css tag xpath Sort button. value_sort_options String css tag xpath Sort options. sleep Integer number seconds use pause actions web page. sort_index Integer index sorting order reviews: 1 ("Relevant"), 2 ("Newest"), 3 ("Highest rating"), 4 ("Lowest rating")

what: Wait until page has finished loading — wait_to_load
title: Wait until page has finished loading — wait_to_load
text: Wait page finished loading element tag value

title: Wait until page has finished loading — wait_to_load
Wait until page has finished loading — wait_to_load
text: client RSelenium client. using String property use find element (e.g. "css", "xpath", etc.) (default: "css"). value String tag page element wait load (default: "body"). sleep Numeric value number seconds wait page load results (default: 1 second).

title: scrappy 0.0.2
text: Added dataset weather stations (including name, state, code) Network Environment Weather Applications (NEWA) Cornell University, scrappy::newa_stations. Added support NEWA v3.0, now using API directly retrieve data, including: hourly, daily, forecasts (hourly daily).

title: scrappy 0.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-09 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added function retrieve weather data Network Environment Weather Applications (NEWA) Cornell University, scrappy::newa_nrcc.
